headline: Chef John's Fresh Salmon Cakes
description: Chef John's recipe for salmon cakes uses fresh wild salmon for a delicious meal any night of the week.
name: Chef John's Fresh Salmon Cakes
recipeIngredient: 1.25 pounds fresh wild salmon, coarsely chopped
1 pinch seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
1 tablespoon panko bread crumbs, or to taste
2 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Heat extra virgin olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion, red pepper, celery, and a pinch of salt in hot oil until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add capers; cook and stir until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.

Stir salmon, onion mixture, mayonnaise, 1/4 cup bread crumbs, garlic, mustard, cayenne, seafood seasoning, salt, and ground black pepper together in a bowl until well-mixed. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until firmed and chilled, 1 to 2 hours.
Form salmon mixture into four 1-inch thick patties; sprinkle remaining panko bread crumbs over each patty.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-heat. Cook patties in hot oil until golden and cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: I've made this many time. Perfect just the way it is. I like to cook it a little longer to crisp them up.
Oh so gooood!

The recipe was absolutely fantastic. The only item I changed was substituting a pinch of lemon/pepper for the seafood seasoning. Pulled all the ingredients together the night before and let it set overnight. Made the patties in the morning and placed them back into the fridge, separated by wax paper, until dinner time. Cooked per the directions and they were fantastic. Did not fall apart during cooking (didn't need the additional egg) - only turned them once during the cooking process. Honestly, I found them tasty enough to not need any additional sauces. Served with a creamy risotto and steamed broccoli. Have no leftovers and requests for more dinners to be the same.
So grateful for Chef John! Another new recipe to me that I would never have thought to make. It was so tasty! I’ve learned so much from him.
Great! Easy to make and the taste is superb!
Incredible. Every time. I don't change a thing.
So good! Didn’t have the hour or two to chill it so substituted an egg. Also added a little extra seasoning. Everyone loved it.

I appreciated the Chef’s approach in making this video. For a retired Construction Manager learning to cook he was detailed but in a lighthearted almost entertaining methodology to cooking. Thank you, Chef John, for a cooking lesson well done.
Have made this a number of times and the whole family loves these Salmon Cakes. Serve a dill cream sauce with it, or a remoulade. Love Chef John's recipes.

I was surprised, this was the first recipe from Chef John that I thought was just so so, I made no changes or additions and I thought they were pretty blah. I'm going to make it again adding an egg for better binding and I'll use Sockeye rather than Coho. Next time I'll use Tartar Sauce because I think it needs something with a fatter taste.
This was awesome. Easy to make. As I sauted the veggies I seasoned them and I seasoned the salmon before mixing them both together. Family loved it. Will definitely make again.

I never knew that not all salmon tasted the same. My husband goes fish in lake Ontario for king salmon (very fishy tasting to me) and before this recipie the only way we would eat it was smoked! THIS RECIPE IS DELICIOUS. Our family has this for dinner about twice month. Thank you so much!
They are good but a lot of work.
These are absolutely fantastic and this will be my go-to salmon recipe moving forward. Absolutely delicious!

I have made this multiple times subbing out some veggies as to use what I have on hand. I love the fact that this does not require baking salmon ahead of time and can be used with raw salmon. They are never dry and hold together well during cooking
This recipe was soooooo good. I followed exactly and it is the perfect salmon cake. Will 100% make again
I don't use the celery, but this is the best ever! Super impressive and delicious!
Used 3 frozensalmon portions and used a burger patty mold to shape Patty's. Cooked immediately after ingredients were combined. Really good. Will make again.

This is my favorite recipe, both as written or with a little more or less salmon or the addition of an egg to hold it together when no time for chilling. I have also used Nature's Path Heritage and Mesa Sunrise cerial ground in place of the Panko for a bit healthier optioin. I have used both leftover or fresh salmon and packaged/canned salmon, or a mix of the two. For a topping, I blend plain Greek yogurt with some dill, garlic powder, lemon juice and salt to taste. Always so good!

Absolutely fantastic!! I followed directions exactly (yes, even the capers which I’m usually not crazy about—I did chop them up a little because the ones I had seemed kind of big. I DO recommend keeping them in the recipe) and I made a remoulade sauce to go over top of them. Topped with a sprinkle of chopped scallions. Ate it for dinner one night, and finished off the rest the next day. My boyfriend had never had salmon Pattie’s before and he LOVED these!!

I made this per the recipe except I had no cayenne pepper so instead I used red pepper flakes. Although the mayo held the patties together just fine, we were not wild about its flavor nor its texture - seemed to almost curdle while cooking - so next time I will omit and use an egg instead. I did refrigerate the mixture for 1-1/2 hours which I’m sure helped bind the patties. Thank you for sharing your recipe.

Delicious recipe. I made a couple of changes, one for convenience, and the other because it seemed like a good idea. I substituted Italian bread crumbs for panko bread crumbs, because we have a LOT of Italian bread crumbs. The second substitution was to replace a portion (roughly 1/4 - 1/3) of the fresh salmon with smoked salmon (not lox), which I thought added a fantastic extra dimension to the taste profile.
You can't go wrong with a Chef John recipe! These were wonderful!

Fantastic! I followed the recipe except blended half of the salmon with lemon juice, Mayo, and 1/4 cup Pankos. 
Then, mixed that with the other half of chopped salmon and made the cakes.
I really liked it. Great way to make salmon.
I followed the recipe exactly as written. Turned out amazing! My husband is not a huge fan of salmon but even he said it was a great meal. Thanks Chef John!
A great recipe. I didn’t have salmon so used barramundi fillets. It was delicious. Made them the next night with left over mix and added hot chilli sauce and lemon zest and oyster sauce. Delicious.

Very nice . I baked them in the convection oven for 4 Mins each side at #350
 just Spray Pan the pan 
 Trying to use less oil

These were amazing! The only things I did different was omitted capers & I used 2 cans of salmon. I refrigerated an hour, then made 6 smaller patty’s, pressed into panko crumbs and froze 30-40 minutes before frying. We served with remoulade sauce My family loves it!

First time I made exactly as written and they were delicious. I did have trouble with them falling apart and I discovered my husband hates capers. Okay so now I leave them out and I add an egg yolk to help bind. I have probably made these 2 dozen times and the basic recipe is easily adaptable to what I have on hand. Finally found a way my husband actually likes fish!
Incredibly good! I made 24 panties and everyone loved them!!!!

I followed this recipe to a tee and it was fantastic! My boyfriend said that these were the best salmon cakes he has ever had (and he is a self proclaimed fish snob). I am so glad I made a double batch so we have some for tonights dinner! Thanks Chef John !
This was so good. Will definitely make again.

This was out of my element and I enjoyed every minute of it. I didn’t let it sit for 1 to 2 hours. Maybe about 30/45 minutes or until bottom of bowl is chilled. Used canola oil to fry extra virgin is quick to burn. Love this recipe. Will be making more.

These are absolutely amazing! My wife and I both agree this is one of our favorite recipes. Anytime we want to impress someone with a meal, this is absolutely a go to. Seriously, they are that good. We make an extra amount and freeze some, then cook them up in our air fryer. Thank you so much Chef John for sharing this with us!!!!

I have always eaten canned salmon prepared as cakes. I love fresh salmon but have just had it grilled…..it is delicious. However, I tried Chef John’s recipe and have decided this is the only way to have salmon cakes. The flavor was so fresh compared to canned. Love, Love Love this recipe.

I pretty much followed, probably added less fish though. I did add a little garlic powder along with about a tablespoon+ of fresh parsley. Instead if the Old Bay, I used Paul Prudhomme Seafood Majic. Using Keto Bread crumbs for inside, panko for outside! I've made this recipe about 7 times now! I half the recipe and eat all patties myself, so I don't eat until I get them made! Fantastic! I did drizzle with some fresh lemon juice.
I love this recipe just as it is!!

This recipe is one of our favourites. I serve it on Brioche Buns and make a tartar sauce to with it. Easy to make the patties ahead of time and cook later. Lovely with a nice summer salad. I serve these often to company and everyone raves about them and asks for the recipe! Make sure you use fresh salmon and cut into smaller chunks.

I made these minus caper and old bsy.. Also, added additional seasonings garlic and onion powder plus chipolte seasonings, and 21 salute seasoning. Relish is a must for my croquettes. I put salmon in my food processor to chop. I did allow to chill for an hour which was enough time to bind without egg. It should list chilling at the beginning of recipe.
excellent flavor and easy to make.
My family enjoyed the salmon cakes, even my picky eater. I used two eggs instead of mayo. Definitely a keeper recipe.

These were delicious. I was hesitant to sacrifice fresh salmon for an “unknown recipe “. I decided to take the plunge and I’m glad I did. I especially like that these cakes are not bready. So many fish cakes have a lot of bread, crumbs or crackers. I found the recipe easy to make and very tasty. Thank you chef John. I’m wondering if I can use other fish with the same ingredients, like maybe cod.
Delicious! Made them just how the recipe called for and they turned out amazing...this is certainly going to get heavy rotation on my weeknight dinner options.
Amazing as written
really good!

I loved it. Through a mistake I used 1 and 1/2 pounds of fresh salmon so a added a little bit more of everything else. In the end it made eight 1/4 cup patties. Tasted great. My wife does not like salmon but she even liked them. The panko crumbs really set them off with extra crunch. I can’t imagine using canned salmon.

OH My! Fantastic! Made it just as it was written. Everyone loved including my non fish fan husband. He said we should have once a week, lol.
We did have it with Chef John’s roulade sauce.
Absolutely perfect. Only thing I did different was chopped olives instead of capers. But it's so, so good.

Great way to stretch a few extra salmon pieces into a full meal. We followed the recipe to a 'T' and it came out great. Served with homemade slaw.

Love Chef John's videos!

What do I think about this recipe ... it's delicious!I suggest that everyone try this recipe
It will always be on my menu
These were phenomenal!!!
These cakes where super delicious and super easy to make. I made mine in air fryer, turned out super yummy!

I thought this recipe sounded fantastic. Unfortunately I did not have a few of the ingredients available BUT I will certainly make again using all of those items. I did not have celery and am sure it would be amazing to include. I used a combo of crushed crotons and the end piece of bread made into crumbs with my food processor. I used leftover salmon (cooked rare) from a previous meal in my salmon cakes. Using “fresh” salmon was so much nicer than using the canned version. I’m looking forward to trying this recipe again, soon. My DH gobbled up these salmon cakes and shared that he loved them! Win, win!
Excellent! I love this recipe!
It was absolutely delicious. I am not a salmon cake fan, but I am with this recipe!
Made exactly as written less capers. Recipe was perfect, flavorful, bonded well. I assembled before work and made into patty’s and cooked after work.

I'm not a great cook so making this was a real gamble. Turns out it was easy, I had all ingredients other than capers, and it turned out to be better than I could have imagined. I made no changes to the recipe and made more than I could ever eat. Wound up eating the leftovers the next day and they were also good. Next time I will cut the recipe in half. Highly recommend.

I absolutely loved this recipe. My husband and I went fishing in Alaska, brought home 100 lbs of fresh caught Salmon. I was looking for a recipe for it knowing how my stepson doesn’t really like fish, but he now loves Salmon!
Absolutely loved it. I did have to substitute frozen for fresh salmon (thaw and dried off before chopping) and instead of capers, put in juice from 1/2 lemon.
It was amazing. Don't need to change a thing but adding a bit of crab meat might improve on perfection!
These salmon croquettes are better than my mom's. I pretty much ate them all by myself. I followed the recipe as directed. The capers gave it a little something special. Thanks Chef John!

Made this twice so far. I think I'm going to need this at least once a month. The first time with cooked salmon it was great, the second with fresh salmon it was out of this world wonderful! Added an egg and coated patty with lots of panko, other than that followed recipe
I made a few times and love it every time. The recipe is spot on.

Wow! So good and simple! I had always been intimidated by making these but thos recipe was foolproof. The only thing I added extra was a bit more panko breading and I like to is Mrs. Dash as seasoning but other than that, it was nice an crispy and very juicy

I thought these were delicious with jus a couple of small tweaks. I did not cook onions celery or peppers first as I enjoy the “ crunch” of the fresh vegetables. I also formed the patties and rolled in plank before frying them for an all over crunchy crust. I cooked in a combo of olive oil and butter ( to add some calories). I WILL make again soon!!!
This wasn't good at all. They didn't hold together. There's better recipes with lower carbs and more protein.
Pretty good. Used leftover salmon. We just aren’t huge fans of salmon patties.

I make a simple pan fried salmon with olive oil, salt and pepper every week and serve it with a different sauce or salsa. My husband loves cold leftovers on salads so I always buy a lot. I had ten ounces this week and decided to take his leftovers and make these cakes. Worked beautifully. I can see making just one or two with leftovers in the future and the size of the cakes doesn't really matter. Cooking the onions, red bell pepper and celery then the capers makes all the difference in flavor. Very, very good.
Pretty good! I left out the mustard but pretty much followed everything else as is. It was very tasty and I would make it again :)
Delish! Like all Chef John's recipes

This was a great way to elevate the salmon patty/cake. I love that Chef John uses fresh salmon instead of canned. The recipes was simple and easy to follow and I have used it numerous times. The patties are light with some briny pops from the capers. A go-to recipe in my house
Made per recipe. Probably won't make again. There was nothing great to make me keep this recipe.
Was looking for a recipe to use up some left over salmon. Very easy to make and really tasty. Will definitely make again.
Excellent, followed the recipe exactly.
Cook the garlic with the veggies. I used the best Salmon but still had to add more Panko to make patties after 2 hours of refrigeration. Labor intensive but worth it.

Made it exactly as directed except capers which the family doesn’t care for. Perfect. We have tweaked it a bit for family taste. We prefer creole mustard to Djon and add a bit of chives. It has now a family staple thanks to this recipe. Thank you.

Didn't have capers and added an egg.
Quite good. I liked the seasoning.
Very tasty cold.
Will make again.

I was looking for how to use my flavorless salmon steaks in the freezer. I came across this recipe which uses fresh salmon. Most recipes call for canned salmon. I watched the video and just followed Chef John's directions with great results! (I made Chef John's remoulade sauce to go with it.) Highly recommended!

On Lake Michigan, we catch a lot of fresh salmon so I was looking for a new way to prepare it. This one a crowd pleaser! Only thing I do now is add more Old Bay, maybe a teaspoon. A pinch is just not enough. Serve with sriracha mayo on a bed of fresh greens. Mmmmmmmmm!

There were incredible. Definitely a bit of a splurge meal, but the quality of the salmon was definitely evident in the cakes and the flavor wasn't lost. The only changes that I made was using regular bread crumbs and a light olive oil rather than EVOO. I appreciate how forgiving Chef John's recipes are: My minced mixture got a bit caramelized, and I had a heck of a time trying to remove the skin from the salmon (I think I need better knives), but they still ended up looking and tasting great. I did make with Chef John's excellent remoulade sauce, and I chopped up the remainder of the onion, red pepper, and celery to make a pretty side salad.
I froze mine, I did taste a little and delicious. Even if I do say so myself. I added ginger/garlic paste, coriander, and a splash of fish sauce.

I would not change the recipe at all it was really really good just the way it was. The only thing I did is after the patties were formed I put them on a plate and put them in the refrigerator to chill for about half an hour that way they stay together in the pan. Looking forward to making it again.
This was very tasty but I think it needed an egg to hold it better together. Served it with salad and oven roasted potatoes. I’d make it again using an egg and some dill.

Made this with a bunch of substitutions in a household of food allergies during quarantine. No bell peppers in the house with allergies to mustard and wheat so I substituted things in like minced cabbage and broccoli stems for the bell pepper and celery. And used rice flour as a binder instead of the bread crumbs. All in all the family really enjoyed it! Thank you!

I made this recipe with a few changes. Neither of us like celery so I substituted niblet sweet corn, added some celery seed and used celery salt (it is the consistency of cooked celery we don’t like, the feeling of it between my teeth makes me gag) instead of regular salt. It turned out great!

I made this following the ingredients for the recipe last night with the exception of using leftover Alaska king salmon fillets I made the previous evening. I also cooked them in my air fryer instead of stovetop at 380 for 8 minutes. Y'all these were so, so good! By far the best salmon cakes I've ever had. Even my picky kids liked them so they'll definitely be in regular rotation at our house now. Thanks for the recipe Chef John and turning my ho-hum salmon into deliciousness!

Was delicious. Only i added a bit more salt...so i would recommend adding a little less than normal so you can adjust it later. But it was a HIT. I almost never cook so this was very nice on the ego :)
They are perfect every time and even great days later.

I had enough Salmon to double the recipe.
Not a fan of Bell Peppers, so omitted that...
I created 8 patties w/ this doubled recipe, wrapped them individually and froze them.
Pan Cooking a pair of frozen patties or individually- Med/Low heat in a covered nonstick pan browning the first side well, and then browning the second side for a shorter time, this lower heat and covered pan made sure the frozen patty was cooked through and not dried out.
Loved the spiciness of this patty, and topped it w/ a bit of Dill sauce, I loved it!
awsome!!

I followed the directions and the only thing I didn't use was capers. I don't normally have those on hand.
My husband just said this is his new favorite meal! It's a hit! I'll be making these again, and again...
Thank you.
YUMMMM
My family loved these and normally they don’t care for salmon cakes. They are now on our regular rotation!! Yummy
So easy and sooo good!
I have never made a salmon patty with raw salmon before, but it worked out very well. I did use butter for browning. They turned out very tender.
I have never made a salmon patty with raw salmon before, but it worked out very well. I did use butter for browning. They turned out very tender.
At first I thought - a lot of ingredients for simple fish cakes but boy are these good! I like the spicy kick. Marvelous!
Great flavor, but they didn't hold together very well-maybe didn't let the mixture chill long enough.
